intro: Gonostemon baylisii, commonly known as the baylisii gonostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
